oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of feeding colostrum that was heat-treated with the Perfect Udder速 System on passive transfer of immunoglobulin G in neonatal Jersey calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kryzer, A. A.
Godden, S. M.
Schell, R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Heat-treating colostrum
pasteurizers
bacteria
immunoglobulin
Perfect Udder速
passive transfer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Heat-treating colostrum by the use of batch pasteurizers is an effective method to reduce bacterial contamination while protecting immunoglobulins and enhancing passive transfer and health in calves. The Perfect Udder速 bag (Dairy Tech Inc., Windsor, CO) is designed to heat-treat 1 gallon (~4 L) of colostrum at a time prior to storage and feeding; however, this system has not been validated. The objective of this study was to compare passive transfer of IgG in neonatal calves that were fed colostrum that was heat-treated with the Perfect Udder速 system, heat-treated with a batch pasteurizer (positive control), or fresh-refrigerated or fresh-frozen (negative controls).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2013; 171
